meanings.definition: Even-toed hoofed mammals, such as deer and cattle.
meanings.sent1: Deer and cattle are examples of artiodactyls.
meanings.sent2: I saw a group of artiodactyls grazing in the field.
meanings.sent3: The artiodactyls decided to have a dance-off to show off their hoof skills.
meanings.sent4: The artiodactyls moved gracefully, their hooves tapping in perfect rhythm.
meanings.sent5: The artiodactyls' even-toed feet make them unique among mammals.

meanings.definition: Animals belonging to the order Artiodactyla.
meanings.sent1: Artiodactyls like deer and cattle are part of the Artiodactyla order.
meanings.sent2: The zoo has a special exhibit featuring various artiodactyls.
meanings.sent3: The artiodactyls in the zoo formed a club to discuss their order's history.
meanings.sent4: In the wild, artiodactyls roam freely, following their natural instincts.
meanings.sent5: The Artiodactyla order includes a diverse range of artiodactyls.

meanings.definition: The group of mammals with an even number of toes on each foot.
meanings.sent1: Artiodactyls have an even number of toes on each foot, distinguishing them from other mammals.
meanings.sent2: I learned in school that artiodactyls are mammals with an even number of toes.
meanings.sent3: The artiodactyls organized a toe-counting competition to see who had the most even toes.
meanings.sent4: The artiodactyls' balanced gait is due to their even toes providing stability.
meanings.sent5: Counting the toes of artiodactyls is a fun way to learn about their unique anatomy.
